title: Pharmacovigilance Principles and Frameworks
description:
Pharmacovigilance is one of the key regulatory functions, and monitors the safe effective use of pharmaceuticals in the real-world healthcare setting. It drives the source of real-world evidence that feedbacks into the regulatory decision-making process, contributes to timely postapproval actions and completes the product life cycle management.

This 4-credit module introduces the principles of pharmacovigilance, regional and global frameworks, as well as the pivotal processes involved in optimal data
collection, collation and signal generation. The need for partnership among regulatory stakeholders is a focus as this is critical in ensuring adequate quality data that is the stem of pharmacovigilance.
